definition: human trafficking/to abduct and sell/to kidnap and sell
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: It is strictly forbidden to ill- treat and sell children and to use child labor.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格禁止虐待和拐賣兒童，禁止使用童工。

sentences.english: The Chinese government is continuing to tackle the problem of child trafficking.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府正繼續整治拐賣兒童的問題。

sentences.english: Many comments demanded the death penalty for anyone caught trafficking children.
sentences.chinese: 許多在線評論要求判處拐賣兒童的犯罪分子死刑。

sentences.english: Faithful grand also at the same time follow at sb' heels and go, think uncover kidnaps and sell dealer this.
sentences.chinese: 忠浩亦同時尾隨而去，想揪出這個拐賣販子。

sentences.english: Chapter one summarized the crime in general.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分是對拐賣婦女犯罪的綜合論述。

sentences.english: What extra measures will China take to fight against child abduction?
sentences.chinese: 中方還將採取哪些措施打擊兒童拐賣行爲？

sentences.english: Authorities have launched an investigation into possible child trafficking against the parents.
sentences.chinese: 當局對這對父母成立了涉嫌拐賣兒童的調查。

sentences.english: If you pay a prostitute, you're financing human trading.
sentences.chinese: 如果你參與嫖娼，你就間接資助了人口拐賣的活動。

sentences.english: It involves allegations that officials ignored kiln-owners' use of abducted boys to perform dangerous work.
sentences.chinese: 它稱官員無視窯主使用被拐賣的男孩從事危險工作。

definition: to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
to bring to justice/to punish according to the law
